intro: Cockburnia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali cockburnia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cockburnia somalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh environment.
